label: UpclickApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the upclick API.

tools.name: CreateChecklist
tools.description:
Creates a checklist on a task with multiple items.

    Use this tool to create a checklist within an existing task by specifying the task ID and the checklist items.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ID of the task to which the checklist will be added. This should be a string representing the unique identifier of the task.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateCustomField
tools.description:
Create a custom field in a specified space.

    This tool creates a custom field within a given space, allowing for complex type-specific configuration. Use this when you need to add or configure custom fields in a space.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: space_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the space where the custom field is to be created. It should be provided as a string.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateTaskInList
tools.description:
Creates a new task with detailed configuration.

    Use this tool to add a new task to a specified list on Upclick, enabling configuration of custom fields, assignees, and dependencies.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the list where the task will be created.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: Specify the team ID if using custom task IDs. Required when custom task IDs are enabled.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference the task by its custom task ID.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"title":"New Task","description":"This is a description of the task."}

tools.name: CreateUpclickList
tools.description:
Create a new list in a space with configurations.

    Use this tool to create a new list within a specified space, including setting status configurations and assigning settings.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: space_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the space where the new list will be created.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTasksInList
tools.description:
Fetch all tasks from a specified list with optional filters.

Use this tool to retrieve all tasks from a particular list. You can apply filters to the results if needed.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the list from which to retrieve tasks.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve for paginated results.

parameters.name: order_tasks_by
parameters.description: Specify the field to order tasks by. Options are 'id', 'created', 'updated', 'due_date'.

parameters.name: filter_by_statuses
parameters.description: Comma-separated list to filter tasks by their statuses.

parameters.name: filter_by_assignees
parameters.description: Comma-separated user IDs to filter tasks by specific assignees.

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter tasks by specific tags.

parameters.name: filter_due_date_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks with a due date later than a specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_due_date_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks with a due date less than this Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_created_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks created after a specified Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: created_before_date
parameters.description: Filter tasks created before the specified date in Unix milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_date_updated_after
parameters.description: Filter tasks to include only those updated after the specified Unix time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_tasks_updated_before
parameters.description: Filter tasks updated before this Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter_by_custom_fields
parameters.description: Provide a JSON array to filter tasks by specific custom fields.

parameters.name: include_archived_tasks
parameters.description: Specify whether to include archived tasks in the results. Set true to include them.

parameters.name: reverse_order
parameters.description: Set to true to reverse the order of the tasks.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Indicates whether to include subtasks. Set to true to include.

parameters.name: include_closed_tasks
parameters.description: Include tasks with a closed status in the results.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrieveTaskDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific task.

Use this tool to obtain details about a specific task by providing its ID. This is ideal for when you need information on a particular task's status, description, and other related details.

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task to retrieve details for.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Provide the team ID. Required if using custom task IDs.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Use true to enable custom task IDs instead of default ones.

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: A boolean indicating whether to include subtasks in the response.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: TrackTimeEntry
tools.description:
Creates a time tracking entry for a task.

    This tool should be called to log time spent on a specific task with detailed metadata, enhancing productivity tracking.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path, query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path, query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: task_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the task to track time against. It is required for logging the task's time entry.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team. This is required when using custom task IDs.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to use custom task IDs when tracking time.  Only used when mode is 'execute'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
UpclickApi toolkit enables developers to integrate with the Upclick API, facilitating seamless interactions for task and checklist management. The toolkit supports various operations that enhance productivity workflows within Upclick.

**Capabilities**
- Create and manage checklists, tasks, and custom fields in a specified Upclick space.
- Fetch details of tasks and lists, applying filters as necessary.
- Track time entries for tasks, improving time management.
- Perform operations based on a defined request schema to ensure successful executions.

**OAuth**
- Provider: ClickUp
- Scopes: None
